frameworks.name: Laravel
frameworks.description: Laravel is a free, open-source PHP web framework intended for the development of web applications following the model–view–controller (MVC) architectural pattern.

frameworks.name: Symfony
frameworks.description: Symfony is a PHP framework for web and console applications and a set of reusable PHP components. It's used as the foundation for many other popular frameworks.

frameworks.name: CodeIgniter
frameworks.description: CodeIgniter is a powerful PHP framework with a very small footprint, built for developers who need a simple and elegant toolkit to create full-featured web applications.

frameworks.name: CakePHP
frameworks.description: CakePHP is a rapid development framework for PHP that provides an extensible architecture for developing, maintaining, and deploying applications.

frameworks.name: Slim
frameworks.description: Slim is a PHP micro framework that helps you quickly write simple yet powerful web applications and APIs.

frameworks.name: Lumen
frameworks.description: Lumen is a micro-framework by Laravel, delivering lightning-fast performance for micro-services and APIs.

frameworks.name: Yii
frameworks.description: Yii is a high-performance, component-based PHP framework for developing modern web applications.

frameworks.name: Laminas
frameworks.description: Laminas Project (formerly Zend Framework) is an open-source, object-oriented web application framework implemented in PHP.

frameworks.name: Phalcon
frameworks.description: Phalcon is an open source full stack framework for PHP, written as a C-extension offering high performance and lower resource consumption.

frameworks.name: WordPress
frameworks.description: While primarily a CMS, WordPress provides a robust framework for building websites, plugins, and web applications.

useCases.name: Enterprise Applications
useCases.description: Large-scale applications with complex business logic requiring reliability, scalability, and long-term support.

useCases.name: REST API Development
useCases.description: Lightweight, fast APIs with minimal overhead focused on delivering data efficiently.

useCases.name: Rapid Application Development
useCases.description: Projects requiring quick development cycles with built-in scaffolding and convention over configuration.

useCases.name: Content Management
useCases.description: Website or application where content creation, publishing, and management are the primary focus.

useCases.name: High-Performance Applications
useCases.description: Applications requiring exceptional speed and low memory footprint, often handling high traffic.

useCases.name: Microservices Architecture
useCases.description: Distributed system built as small, independent services that communicate over a network.

useCases.name: Legacy System Integration
useCases.description: Projects that need to work with or gradually replace older PHP systems while maintaining compatibility.

useCases.name: E-commerce Platforms
useCases.description: Online stores and marketplaces requiring robust cart systems, payment processing, and product management.

levels.title: PHP Fundamentals
levels.description: Match popular PHP frameworks with their basic use cases. Perfect for beginners!

levels.title: Micro vs Full-Stack
levels.description: Learn the difference between micro-frameworks and full-stack solutions.

levels.title: Specialized Solutions
levels.description: Match frameworks with more specialized application requirements.

levels.title: Performance Champions
levels.description: Focus on frameworks known for their speed and efficiency.

levels.title: Framework Master
levels.description: The ultimate challenge! Match a wide variety of frameworks with their ideal use cases.
